author: National Bureau
text:
The Cabinet Committee on Parliamentary Affairs (CCPA) finalised the dates for the budget session of Parliament that will commence on February 23, with the Union budget being presented on February 29.

There will, however, be no curtailment of the session or the recess period on account of Assembly elections in five States due shortly.

Rail budget on Feb. 25

“The Railway Budget will be presented on February 25 and the pre-Budget economic survey on February 26. The first part of the budget session will end on March 16 and the second part will be convened from April 25 to May 13,” said Parliamentary Affairs Minister Venkaiah Naidu.

He said there were suggestions for curtailing the recess period due to Assembly elections in four States and one Union Territory, but the government as well as political parties wanted a full session.

Session won’t be curtailed owing to Assembly elections
title: Union Budget to be presented on February 29
